alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 29 at 3:21PM MST until June 29 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 320 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Estrella Sailport to 9 miles south of South Mountain Park to near Chandler Fashion Center Mall to Chandler to near Tumbleweed Park to near Queen Creek, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 125 and 176. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 210. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 10. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Glendale, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Laveen, Cashion, East Mesa and Sun Lakes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
